intro: Arctotis debensis, commonly known as the narrowleaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Arctotis debensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
